Title: Research Scientist Intern, Human-Computer Interaction (PhD) | Chercheur stagiaire, Interaction homme-machine (niveau doctoral) - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
At Reality Labs, our goal is to invent the user interface technologies that will drive the next generation of augmented-reality experiences. Our aim is to unleash human potential by erasing the bottlenecks between intent and action. As a Research Intern, you will focus on developing novel interactions and interfaces for augmented reality glasses and wearable devices.We are looking for PhD candidates to work alongside experts researchers, designers, and software engineers. We are open to candidates from a broad scope of relevant backgrounds such as:*Human-computer interaction*Computer science*Software engineering & related engineering fields*Psychology, cognitive science, neuroscience*Design*Game development*Ergonomics & kinesiology *Statistics & machine learningMore specifically, we are looking for candidates with background in one or more of the following areas:Human-computer interaction*Input and interaction techniques*Multi-modal input*Adaptive user interfaces & personalization*Mixed-initiative interfaces*Collaborative interactions and multi-user systems*Gesture input and gesture learningHaptics*Experience design, feedback and guidance*Perception*Haptic hardware prototyping*Wearable hapticsVisual interfaces in AR/VR*3D user interaction & hybrid interfaces*Immersion, presence & agency*Locomotion & navigation*360 environments & videosSoftware engineering*Software architecture and design patterns*Application frameworks*Desktop, mobile and web platform development*Game developmentAccessibility in AR/VR*Assistive pointing techniques and technology*Assistive technologies such as screen readers, mobility aids, or braille interfaces*Fitness technology and/or exergaming*Game BalancingSensors and hardware*Prototyping*Wearables*Eye tracking*Graphics and audioUser-centered machine learning*Predictive modeling*Intent modeling*Computational interaction*Computer visionOur internships are sixteen (16) to twenty four (24) weeks long and we have various start dates throughout the year. This position is based in Toronto, Canada.-Chez Reality Labs, nous voulons inventer les technologies d'interface utilisateur qui seront à l'origine de la prochaine génération d'expériences de réalité augmentée. Nous avons pour but de libérer le potentiel humain en supprimant les goulots d’étranglement entre l’intention et l’action. En tant que chercheur stagiaire, vous vous concentrerez sur le développement de nouvelles interactions et interfaces pour les lunettes de réalité augmentée et les dispositifs portables.Nous recherchons des doctorants pour travailler aux côtés de chercheurs experts, de concepteurs et d’ingénieurs logiciels. Nous sommes ouverts aux doctorants disposant de toutes sortes d'expériences pertinentes en la matière, par exemple :* Interaction homme-machine* Informatique* Ingénierie logicielle et domaines d'ingénierie connexes* Psychologie, sciences cognitives, neurosciences* Conception* Développement de jeux* Ergonomie et kinésiologie * Statistiques et apprentissage automatiquePlus précisément, nous recherchons des doctorants ayant une expérience dans un ou plusieurs des domaines suivants :Interaction homme-machine* Techniques des données et de l'interaction* Programmation multimodale* Interfaces utilisateur adaptatives et personnalisation* Interfaces à initiative mixte* Interactions collaboratives et systèmes multi-utilisateurs* Saisie gestuelle et apprentissage des gestesHaptique* Conception de l'expérience, retour d'information et conseils* Perception* Prototypage de matériel haptique* Haptique portableInterfaces visuelles en RA/RV* Interaction utilisateur 3D et interfaces hybrides* Immersion, présence et agence* Locomotion et navigation* Environnements et vidéos à 360°Ingénierie logicielle* Architecture logicielle et modèles de conception* Cadres d’application* Développement de plateformes de bureau, mobiles et web* Développement de jeuxAccessibilité en RA/RV* Techniques et technologies d’aide au pointage* Technologies d’assistance telles que lecteurs d’écran, aides à la mobilité ou interfaces en braille* Technologie du fitness et/ou exergaming* Calibrage du jeuCapteurs et matériel* Prototypage* Vêtements* Traçage oculaire* Graphiques et audioApprentissage automatique centré sur l’utilisateur* Modélisation prédictive* Modélisation de l’intention* Interaction informatique* Vision par ordinateurNos stages sont d’une durée de seize(16) à vingt-quatre(24) semaines et nous avons plusieurs dates de début tout au long de l’année. Ce poste est basé à Toronto, au Canada.
Plan and execute cutting-edge research to advance human-computer interaction research. | Planifiez et exécutez des recherches de pointe pour faire progresser la recherche sur l’interaction homme-machine.
Collaborate with dynamic teams of engineers, designers and researchers. | Collaborez avec des équipes dynamiques d’ingénieurs, de concepteurs et de chercheurs.
Organize and lead research activities such as designing and building prototypes, experimental design as well as data collection and analysis. | Organisez et dirigez des activités de recherche telles que la conception et la construction de prototypes, la conception expérimentale ainsi que la collecte et l’analyse de données.
Write and publish high quality scientific articles. | Rédigez et publiez des articles scientifiques de haute qualité.
Communicate research activities and findings to collaborators across a variety of disciplines. | Communiquez vos activités de recherche et résultats à vos collaborateurs issus de diverses disciplines.
Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a PhD. | Actuellement doctorant.e ou titulaire d'un doctorat.
3+ years of experience with programming languages such as Python, R, C++, C#, Matlab. | Au moins trois ans d’expérience avec des langages de programmation tels que Python, R, C++, C#, Matlab.
1+ years of experience in experimental design of user studies and statistical analysis to interpret results. | Au moins un an d’expérience en conception expérimentale d’études sur les utilisateurs et en analyse statistique pour interpréter les résultats.
Interpersonal skills: cross-group collaboration and cross-culture collaboration. | Compétences interpersonnelles : collaboration transversale et collaboration interculturelle
Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment. | Doit obtenir un permis de travail dans le pays où se trouve l’emploi à la date d’embauche et maintenir ce permis pendant la durée de l’emploi.
Familiarity with the HCI field. | Familiarité avec le domaine des IHM.
Familiarity with AR/VR technologies and literature. | Bonne connaissance des technologies et de la littérature en matière de réalité augmentée ou virtuelle.
Familiarity with Unity game engine. | Une aisance avec le moteur de jeu Unity.
Proven track record of achieving research results and innovation as demonstrated by minimum 2 patents or first-authored peer-reviewed publications in relevant venues such as ACM CHI, ACM UIST, ACM IMWUT, IEEE ISMAR or IEEE VR. | Une expérience avérée dans l’obtention de résultats de recherche et l’innovation, comme en témoignent au moins deux brevets ou des publications rédigées en tant qu'auteur principal, évaluées par les pairs et parues dans des revues pertinentes comme ACM CHI, ACM UIST, ACM IMWUT, IEEE ISMAR ou IEEE VR.
Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op. | Intention de retourner au programme d’études après l’achèvement du stage ou du programme coopératif
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Title: Staff DevOps Engineer (Portals) - Ontario - Indeed.com
Description:
Datto, the world's leading provider of IT solutions delivered through managed service providers,
is looking for a Staff DevOps Engineer to join a growing team. Datto is a creative company at
its core and is an exciting and dynamic workplace. We're 100% focused on our managed service
provider partners and believe that with the right technology, managed service providers can
change how businesses around the world operate. Datto provides data protection, business
continuity, networking, business management, and file backup and sync products that empower
and protect the clients of our 14,000+ partners. We're headquartered in Norwalk, Connecticut
and have 22 offices worldwide.
About You
More than someone who checks every box, we're looking for people who are excited to work
and grow at Datto. If that's you we hope you apply for the role!
You enjoy teamwork
You come with new ideas and a unique point of view. You look forward to collaborating with a
diverse team. You eagerly seek and give help. Transparency tops your list of values, and you
contribute to a culture of respect and inclusion.
You're inquisitive
Inquisitive and focused, you see every challenge as an opportunity. You would rather create the
future than wait for it.
You're customer-focused and take pride in your work.
You put extra attention into details with all you do. You care about the work you provide to
customers and how it reflects on yourself and Datto. When you find or see something wrong, you
attempt to resolve it. You look for opportunities to not only better yourself, but others around
you. You aim to be the best that you can be and always do the right thing.
What You'll Do
As a Staff DevOps Engineer you will join the SaaS Engineering team - working closely with
Software Development, QE, Infrastructure, and Operations teams to develop tools to facilitate
our software development and release processes, enable build and deployment pipelines, and
manage development and test environments.
Job function and responsibilities include :
Contribute to the maturing DevOps/Release Engineering function of Datto SaaS
Protection utilizing methodologies such as Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery,
Agile, and Test-Driven Development
Collaborate with the Product, Software Development, and Quality Engineering teams to
reduce cycle time and increase overall quality and stability
Design, develop, support, and maintain the deployment pipeline that brings code from
developer to production
Integrate with all of the relevant systems (e.g. source code management, build, change
control, test automation) to ensure that code changes move smoothly through the pipeline
with as little human intervention as possible
Work hand in hand with the engineering team to optimize developer productivity
ensuring that developer deployments can be done quickly and efficiently
Partner and collaborate with the central DevOps team, which looks after the core
infrastructure, and other functional DevOps teams across the broader portfolio of Datto
products and services
Monitor internal engineering systems
Build and maintain efficient, reusable and reliable code
Troubleshoot complex issues quickly and effectively; continually improve processes and
reliability of the deployment pipeline
About You:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Experience in software development, automation, infrastructure as code, and data-driven
analysis
Experience building, managing, and supporting Kubernetes clusters
Background leading and driving implementation and processes around configuration
management tools such as Puppet, Ansible, and Salt
Hands-on experience with mainline programming and scripting languages such as Shell,
Python, Ruby, and Perl
Experience packaging and deploying software on and operating Linux or other UNIX
variants
Familiar with standard tools and platforms that enable continuous delivery such as
GitLab, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Docker, JIRA, and ServiceNow.
Virtualized hardware and infrastructure experience
Solid understanding of the development lifecycle and how code flows from development
to production
Strong root cause analysis and troubleshooting competency
Strong tendency to automate and monitor everything
Excellent Communication Skills
Ability to operate in a fast paced environment
Self-motivated & willing to learn
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Benefits:
At Datto, we're committed to cultivating a healthy, positive and growth enabling environment. We are proud of our wide ranging benefits package which is available to all full-time employees, including:
Comprehensive health-care benefits
Flexible paid time off policy
Generous paid paternal leave
"Datto University" virtual on-boarding program
Access to more than 5,000 courses via LinkedIn Learning
Education reimbursement
Employee Assistance Program
Headspace App
Charity match program
A dynamic and socially active work culture, including Employee Resource Groups
Networking and career development opportunities
And more!
Note: We are looking only for candidates willing to join us directly as W2 employees (No 3rd party candidates)
By submitting an application, you acknowledge we will process your data to consider you for the
position you apply for and for other open positions within our company for which you may be
suited. We collect and store your data following our Recruiting Privacy Practices.
Datto is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Estimator/Purchaser - Winnipeg, MB - Indeed.com
Description:
Norcen Distributors is a local, family run building supply company since 1997. Located in Headingley just outside the perimeter on Wilkes Avenue. We are looking for hard working individuals to join our team.
Norcen Distributors 7727 Wilkes Ave Headingley, MB R4H 1B8
Full Time – 40 hours per week
Monday-Friday 7am-4pm or 8am-5pm shift
Competitive salary based on experience and a benefits plan.
Estimator/Inside sales
Job Duties:
· Ability to work with POS system
· Creating and receiving PO’s, tracking inventory
· Process money, cheque and credit/debit card payment
· Assist customers with lumber and hardware needs for projects
· Responding to customer inquiries and offering product knowledge.
· Excellent oral and written English skills required
· Computer literacy required (MS Word, Excel, and Email).
· Answering phones, forwarding calls, greeting customers and suppliers
· General help for other office staff
· Office and building cleaning
· Perform timely and accurate blueprint take-offs using customer supplied blueprints, (lumber, hardware, doors/millwork, windows, steel etc)
· display competency in talking to architects/ engineers/ contractors in relation to structural designs, and articulate/ support your takeoff and vision of the plan
· Create accurate bids and materials price lists for sales Staff in a timely manner
· Source new and Special-Order products to fulfill project needs
· Purchasing Stock and Special-order items.
· Purchased items include: lumber, engineered floors and trusses, siding, insulation, structural steel, fasteners, windows, doors, decking, flooring, etc
Job Requirements:
Must have your own transportation – there is no bus to location
Strong mathematical skills with high degree of accuracy
Ability to accurately read and interpret construction drawings
· Previous experience or knowledge of building materials
· Experience in Residential and/or Commercial Construction is preferable
· Work well with others in a team environment and the ability to work independently
· Punctual and self-motivated
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Benefits:
Dental care
Extended health care
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday
Experience:
construction estimating: 1 year (preferred)
Work remotely:
No

Title: Embedded Software Engineer (Boucherville) - Boucherville, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Contribute to the development of Powertrain!
Purpose as an Embedded Software Engineer, you are an active member of the SW development’s team.
Your challenges
Analyze, design, develop & testing of software components to ASPICE/ISO 26262/AGILE methodology & standards.
Work closely with the electronics and hardware departments to ensure design of electronics and hardware can support the software requirements.
Support Architecture design and development.
Create details designs to link the software implementation to the requirements.
Develop software code in C to implement the software design.
Develop Software in MATLAB Simulink/Stateflow environment.
Conduct unit test to validate the software implementation.
Support issue analysis and corrective action definitions.
Take part in various development in the software development life cycle.
Your strengths
Bachelor’s degree in Electronics Engineering, Computer Science or related discipline.
Essential: Minimum of five (5+) years of relevant experience in embedded software development.
Essential : Member of the OIQ (Ordre des Ingénieurs du Québec)
Essential: Knowledge of Simulink Test (MIL/SIL)
Essential: Knowledge of embedded systems testing with MIL, SIL, PIL.
Essential : Knowledge of C/C++ embedded systems
Knowledge of Python (an asset)
Knowledge of ISO 26262 (an asset)
Experience with SPI, CAN, CANFD, J1939, UDS, and XCP communication protocols
Experience developing software in accordance with a formal V-based software development process (based on ASPICE).
Professional experience required
Expert in OS/BSP, device driver development such as Flash, ADC, EEPROM, LIN, CANFD, SPI, etc.
Expert in design, implementation, testing and debugging of embedded software for automotive electronics module.
Expert knowledge of real-time embedded software for 32-bit multicore microcontrollers.
Expert knowledge of floating point computing development and methods.
Knowledge of how to use and the utility of the software development team tools listed below:
Requirements: Polarion
MBD: Matlab/Simulink + Toolbox (Simulink Requirements, Simulink Tests, etc.)
Software devOps tools: Jira, ,Azure Git, CMake, Artifactory, etc.
Static code analysis tools: Polyspace, etc.
Software unit testing and software integration testing: VectorCAST, etc.
LauterBach debugger
Automotive communication tools (Vector Canape, CANalyzer/CANoe, & CANdela)
Ability to work with multidisciplinary teams
Curious and autonomous
Rigorous and strong ability to meet deadlines
Commitment to the highest standards of ethical behavior in self and others; commitment to inclusion and diversity
Good analytical skills
Proven ability to be proactive and forward thinking.
Hands-on person.
You will work in an international and multicultural team.
Why be part of our driving force?
We are a dynamic and growing Quebec-based SME that promotes creativity, innovation and collaboration
We stand out for the multidisciplinary and multicultural nature of our team
We have flexible working hours and offer the possibility of summer hours
We offer the Dana TM4 shuttle service from the Longueuil metro station
Our social club organizes a multitude of activities: running club, Oktoberfest, barbecues, dessert club, 5@7, comedy night, etc.

Title: BHJOB15656_16718 - Senior Application Engineer/Architect - Ontario - Indeed.com
Description:
Position Summary
The Senior Application Support Engineer/Architect will perform software application engineering to provide build-out, troubleshooting and deep configuration knowledge of the Oracle ATG stack, and enterprise e-commerce engineering.
Roles Responsibilities:
Perform software application engineering of eCommerce customer environments, providing environment build-out, troubleshooting and configuration
Implementation and troubleshooting of middleware.
Migration and support of clients to cloud environments.
Work on both strategic short and long term issues and projects. Build strong relationships with clients at various levels and other operations teams.
Interact with multiple departments on a regular basis, and the presentation of information to both technical and business stakeholders.
Tasked with providing engineering and hands on management with minimal oversight from the greater organization.
Perform daily support tasks (support tickets, deployments, troubleshooting, etchellip;).
Work with end customers to improve and stabilize their applications.
Improve existing deployment and support processes.
Application improvements (deployment scripts, automation, application configuration etc.)
Participate in rotating on-call schedule.
Key Skills and Competencies:
Application Environment Management
Content Delivery Network (CDN) - akamai, cloudflare, others
Software/hardware load balancers
Certificate management - at CDN, webserver and application layers (keystores)
Ability to manage and troubleshoot traffic flow in/out of an environment
Support and analysis of environment performance/load tests
Webserver experience: Apache or nginx
Installation and configuration
Troubleshooting error codes
Rewrite / redirect rules
Application server experience: Weblogic, jboss
Installation and configuration
Troubleshooting application issues
Patching and updating
Java application support
Memory heap tuning, thread and heap dump analysis
Java application troubleshooting and support
Relational database experience (MySQL, Oracle DB)
Creating, reviewing, running sql
Exporting and importing of data
User creation and management
Experienced Linux operator, able to perform required tasks efficiently within a Linux environment.
Ability to holistically review an application, identify and address issues real time.
Nice To Haves:
Oracle Commerce (ATG) or other eCommerce application support experience preferred
Top tier front end web server skills (apache, nginx,), software/hardware load balancers, Cloudflare, Akamai, containers (kubernetes, docker), experience with cloud projects/migrations (Azure, AWS), jboss, Weblogic
Proficient with ticketing systems such as Atlassian service desk, Jira
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, or a directly related field

Title: Full Stack Software Developer at Taiv - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
What We Do
Taiv (YC W20) uses ML to make TV commercials as targeted and accessible as Facebook ads. We’re democratizing TV by letting anyone advertise for as little as $300.
Why It Matters?
We think that all ad channels should be accessible to everyone. Right now, only big companies can buy TV spots, plus they are poorly targeted and hard to track. We want to change that and transform a $150bn market in the process. We also share the revenue with the people who own the TVs, which we think is the way that advertising should work.
Cool, But How Does It Work?
We partner with bars and install custom hardware, which attaches to their cable box and uses computer vision to detect commercials in real-time (more about that below). When it cuts to commercial break, we dynamically insert ads that are perfect for that environment. We sell the ads at a premium and then give the bars 30%.
Check It Out
TechCrunch: https://techcrunch.com/2020/03/16/no-mute-necessary-taiv-replaces-live-tv-ads-at-bars-with-custom-content/
Demo video: https://youtu.be/JjI_jZRoesY
Who We're Looking For
We're looking for a full stack developer who works hard and wants to get in early and grow with the company. We develop hardware, firmware, web, android, and ML. Your role will be mostly focused on Android, web, and backend, but we're a small team and everyone wears a lot of hats. There's always room to grow into whichever area you enjoy the most!
As a founding engineer, you'll be integral in solving our toughest problems and building systems that will scale to millions. You'll have lots of responsibility and ownership of the projects that you work on.
We're based in Winnipeg, MB, and are looking for someone who is interested in relocating to our head office.
Requirements
Experience designing, testing, building and deploying projects
Hardworking & a fast learner
Loves startups and wants their work to have an impact : )
Bonus
Experience with OpenCV & computer vision
Experience building scalable systems
Strong multi-threaded Java skills
Entrepreneurially minded
Our Tech
We have really cool tech - we build our own hardware and use a heuristics-based computer vision approach for classification. We’re the first (and only) company in the world that can detect TV commercials accurately.
Our detection algorithm runs on our custom-designed TV box that we manufacture in-house. We have hundreds of boxes deployed and are installing more every day.
We also have several web apps built in React that are used by our customers, as well as for internal operations.
Our Stack
Android (Java, c, c++)
OpenCV
React / React Native
Firebase
Google Cloud Functions
AWS (S3, Cloudfront)
Bash
Circleci
You don't need to know all of these, but what you don't know, be ready to learn quickly!
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Pay: $60,000.00-$150,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Casual dress
Dental care
Extended health care
Life insurance
On-site parking
Paid time off
Stock options
Vision care
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Application question(s):
What is your coolest personal project? : )
